snippet: A floating home cannot be regulated under federal admiralty law, the Supreme Court ruled in a colorful decision that featured a dissenting opinion.
abstract: Supreme Court, in colorful opinion, rules that a floating home is not vessel to be regulated under federal admiralty law; case was closely watched by businesses that operate floating casinos, restaurants and hotels.
lead_paragraph: A floating home cannot be regulated under federal admiralty law, the Supreme Court ruled in a colorful decision that featured a dissenting opinion.

headline.seo: Justices Say Home That Floats Is Not a Boat
headline.main: It May Float, but a Home Isn’t a Boat, Justices Rule
headline.print_headline: It May Float, But a Home Isn’t a Boat, Justices Rule
